words.def: To act or perform beforehand.
floor covering consisting of a piece of thick heavy fabric (usually with nap or pile)
a summary at the end that repeats the substance of a longer discussion
a horse used to set the pace in racing
The time number of days by which a solar year  exceeds twelve lunar month s; it is used in the calculation of the date of Easter.
move slowly
small very thin pancake
any of numerous plants of the genus Capparis
give what is desired or needed, especially support, food or sustenance
Lively; active.
a mark used by an author or editor to indicate where something is to be inserted into a text
a list of dishes available at a restaurant
a rugged box (usually made of wood)
an informal use of the Latin word for father
idle or foolish and irrelevant talk
show a response or a reaction to something

a just detectable amount
a strip of land projecting into a body of water
a written agreement between two states or sovereigns
the rate of moving (especially walking or running)
obscene terms for feces
the lean flesh of a fish that is often farmed
partially carbonized vegetable matter saturated with water
someone who copies the words or behavior of another
characterized by a lightly pert and exuberant quality
the work of providing treatment for or attending to someone or something
decrease gradually or bit by bit
a heavy open wagon usually having two wheels and drawn by an animal
A delicacy or item of food.
sweet juicy gritty-textured fruit available in many varieties
the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on
a unit of area (4840 square yards) used in English-speaking countries

any competition

gather, as of natural products

something determined in relation to something that includes it
liver or meat or fowl finely minced or ground and variously seasoned
a magnitude or frequency relative to a time unit

a drop of the clear salty saline solution secreted by the lacrimal glands

An edible mushroom Boletus edulis .
a tight-fitting headdress
electrical conduction through a gas in an applied electric field
A recommendation or suggestion.
(golf) the standard number of strokes set for each hole on a golf course, or for the entire course
the sound made by a gentle blow
seed of a pea plant used for food
the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number
a domesticated animal kept for companionship or amusement
a reproach for some lapse or misdeed
informal abbreviation of `representative'
feline mammal usually having thick soft fur and no ability to roar: domestic cats

(usually followed by `to') naturally disposed toward

the products of human creativity

a terrorist organization organized in 1959 by student activists who were dissatisfied with the moderate nationalism of the traditional Basque party
any of various long-tailed rodents similar to but larger than a mouse
place (flax, hemp, or jute) in liquid so as to promote loosening of the fibers from the woody tissue
any of various dark heavy viscid substances obtained as a residue

the 17th letter of the Hebrew alphabet
an informal term for a father

a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
